results.title: High pressure drums
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the manufacture of high pressure boiler drums in one of Britain’s leading engineering works. Scenes of the installation of drums during the construction of a new atomic power plant show one of the many fields of industry in which this article is an essential component.

results.title: High noon in Jakarta
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Christine Olsen, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Olsen Levy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big picture”.
A look at the life of Abdurrahman Wahid, the first democratically elected President of Indonesia and the many challenges he faces in governing this highly fragmented society. Shows the pressure Wahid faces from the Army, which is reluctant to hand over powers it gained under the 30 years of General Soeharto’s dictatorship. Follows Wahid on a foreign trip while back in Indonesia General Wiranto, the Indonesian military leader, has been accused of human rights abuses against the East Timorese people. An interesting and insightful documentary of President Wahid, his family, his Islamic beliefs and philosophy, and his political diplomacy with foreign leaders and the international media. Includes images of some personal and upfront moments in Wahid’s daily rituals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Curtis Levy, Christine Olsen, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Olsen Levy

results.title: High noon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer, United Artists Corporation and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: A retired marshall is forced to take up his badge and guns again when a killer he has sent to jail returns to town seeking revenge. The townspeople refuse to help and his new bride wants him to run away from the fight. The marshall meets the killer and his three accomplices at high noon in one of the most suspenseful and thrilling gunfights ever filmed. Cast includes Gary Cooper and Grace Kelly. Based on the story ‘The Tin star’ by John W. Cunningham.

results.title: High mountain venture
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Ross Matthews
results.brief_description: Shows the activities offered to boys at the Education Department’s school camp at Bogong, Victoria. A balanced program of conservation studies and challenging physical activities is the highlight of this very popular camp. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: High mark
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian Football Council and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A record of the 1947 Grand Final match between two league teams - Carlton and Essendon. The game is fought to an exciting finish, with only one point between the winning and losing team - Carlton 86 points to Essendon 85 points. Narrated by Eric Welch

results.title: High jump and pole vault
results.creator_credit: Department of Education, Queensland and Ron Taylor
results.brief_description: Shows American high jumper Nat Page, demonstrating his own style of the Fosbury flop. Presents the warm up routines, techniques and drills required for progression towards the complete skills.

results.title: High Jump
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching tips for high jump events from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of high jump events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: High jump
results.creator_credit: Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The techniques and steps to successful performance in the highjump event. Shows the two main principles in high jumping, illustrated with diagrams, maximising lift in practice, pointing out faults in the style of the athlete; clearing the bar by the “role” method in which the body rotates over the bar; preparatory training exercises for athletes and training procedure being practised under the direction of a coach.
